com.b2international.snowowl.core.api

Interface IBranchPath

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    NullBranchPath

    public interface IBranchPath
extends java.io.Serializable
    Branch path representation.

    NOTE:  This class is not intended to be neither implemented not extended by clients. Use the utility class BranchPathUtils to obtain actual instances.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String EMPTY_PATH
      Empty path.
      static java.lang.String MAIN_BRANCH
      The ID or name of the MAIN branch.
      static java.lang.String SEPARATOR
      The path separator.
      static char SEPARATOR_CHAR
      The path separator character.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getOsParentPath()
      Returns a string representation of this parent branch path which uses the platform-dependent path separator defined by File.
      java.lang.String getOsPath()
      Returns a string representation of this branch path which uses the platform-dependent path separator defined by File.
      IBranchPath getParent()
      Returns with the parent branch path of the current branch path.
      java.lang.String getParentPath()
      Returns with the parent branch path instance.
      java.lang.String getPath()
      Returns with the fully qualified path uniquely identifying a branch.
      java.lang.String lastSegment()
      Returns with the last segment of the current branch path.

    • Field Detail

      • SEPARATOR

        static final java.lang.String SEPARATOR
        The path separator. "/".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SEPARATOR_CHAR

        static final char SEPARATOR_CHAR
        The path separator character. 47.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAIN_BRANCH

        static final java.lang.String MAIN_BRANCH
        The ID or name of the MAIN branch. Value: "MAIN".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EMPTY_PATH

        static final java.lang.String EMPTY_PATH
        Empty path.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getPath

        java.lang.String getPath()
        Returns with the fully qualified path uniquely identifying a branch. The given path represents the hierarchy among the branches. All segments of the path represent the name of a branch. 
         MAIN∕VERSION_1∕TASK_300
        Returns:
        the branch path.
        See Also:
        SEPARATOR

      • getParentPath

        java.lang.String getParentPath()
        Returns with the parent branch path instance. As the branch path can be stored in a taxonomy always exactly one parent branch can be associated with a branch. The MAIN branch is exceptional as it does not have a parent.
        Returns:
        the path of the parent branch.

      • getOsPath

        java.lang.String getOsPath()
        Returns a string representation of this branch path which uses the platform-dependent path separator defined by File. This method is like getPath() except that the latter always uses the same separator (SEPARATOR) regardless of platform.

        This string is suitable for passing to File.File(String).

        Returns:
        a platform-dependent string representation of this branch path.

      • getOsParentPath

        java.lang.String getOsParentPath()
        Returns a string representation of this parent branch path which uses the platform-dependent path separator defined by File. This method is like getParentPath() except that the latter always uses the same separator (SEPARATOR) regardless of platform.

        This string is suitable for passing to File.File(String).

        Returns:
        a platform-dependent string representation of this parent branch path.

      • getParent

        IBranchPath getParent()
        Returns with the parent branch path of the current branch path.
        Returns:
        the parent branch path.

      • lastSegment

        java.lang.String lastSegment()
        Returns with the last segment of the current branch path.

        If the branch path is: 

         MAIN∕VERSION_1∕TASK_300
        then this method returns with the following: 
         TASK_300
        This method never returns with null.
        Returns:
        the last segment of the current branch path.
